What is a Moneyline Bet?

A moneyline bet is the simplest form of basketball wagering. You just pick the team you believe will win the game outright. Odds indicate the likelihood of each team winning, with favorites offering smaller payouts and underdogs offering higher ones.

How Does Point Spread Betting Work?

Point spread betting adds a handicap, or “spread,” that the favored team must cover to win the bet. For example, if the spread is 7 points, the favorite must win by more than 7 for your bet to pay out. If they win by exactly 7, it’s a push, and your stake is refunded. Some spreads use half-points (e.g., 7.5) to prevent a push.

What Are Over/Under (Totals) Bets?

Over/under bets, also called totals, focus on the combined score of both teams. You bet on whether the total points will be over or under a predetermined number, regardless of which team wins. You can also bet on totals for individual teams, quarters, or halves.

What Are Prop Bets?

Prop bets, or proposition bets, involve wagering on specific events or performances during the game. These bets can cover a wide range of possibilities, such as how many points a player will score or whether a team will hit a certain number of three-pointers. They add excitement by focusing on aspects that might not affect the game’s final outcome.

What Is Live/In-Game Betting?

Live or in-game betting allows you to place wagers on a game while it’s happening. The odds and lines continuously change in real-time based on the flow of the game, giving bettors the chance to adjust their bets as the action unfolds.
